definition[0]: a piece of equipment shaped like a tube, used for making distant objects look larger and closer
example[0]: Details on the Moonâ€™s surface can only be seen through a telescope.
definition[1]: to make a process or set of events happen in a shorter time
example[1]: The whole legal process was telescoped into a few weeks.
definition[2]: if something telescopes, the parts of it press together or slide over each other, and it becomes smaller
example[2]: The front of the car telescoped when it hit the wall.
